title: Using derivatives to recognize graph of function

content.question: Let f be a function that is continuous on the closed interval [-2,3] such that f'(0) does not exist, f'(2) = 0, and f''(x) < 0 for all x except xÂ = 0. Which of the following could be the graph of f?

choices.label: A coordinate plane shows a piecewise continuous curve. The curve declines with a concave upward trend from a solid dot with the value negative 2 on the x-axis, in quadrant 2, and intersects the positive y-axis. It rises in quadrant 1 to the value 2 on the x-axis, and then dips to a solid dot with the value 3 on the x-axis, in the same quadrant. The values negative 2, 2, and 3 are marked on the x axis.

A coordinate plane shows a piecewise continuous curve. The curve rises with a concave downward trend from a solid dot with the value negative 2 on the x-axis, in quadrant 2, and intersects the positive y-axis. It declines in quadrant 1 to the value 2 on the x-axis, and then rises to a solid dot with the value 3 on the x-axis, in the same quadrant. The values negative 2, 2, and 3 are marked on the x axis.

A coordinate plane shows a curve that rises from a solid dot at x equals negative 2 in quadrant 3. It intersects the x-axis at a value of about negative 1 and also intersects the positive y-axis. It continues to rise in quadrant 1, peaks at a value of 2 on the x-axis, then dips and intersects the x-axis at a value of 3, and finally culminates in quadrant 4, at a solid dot with a value of 3 on the x-axis. The values negative 2, 2, and 3 are marked on the x axis.

A coordinate plane plots a discontinuous piecewise curve. One curve declines with a concave downward trend, from a solid dot with a value of negative 2 on the x-axis in quadrant 3, to a solid dot on the negative y-axis. The second curve starts from a solid dot on the positive y-axis, rises in quadrant 1, and peaks at a value of about 2 on the x-axis. The curve declines and culminates at a solid dot with a value of 3 on the x-axis. The values negative 2, 2, and 3 are marked on the x axis.

A coordinate plane plots a piecewise continuous curve. It starts from a solid dot at x equals negative 2 in quadrant 2, declines with a concave downward trend, and intersects the positive y-axis. The curve then rises in quadrant 1, peaks at a value of about 2 on the x-axis. The curve declines and culminates at a solid dot with a value of 3 on the x-axis. The values negative 2, 2, and 3 are marked on the x axis.

content.answer: A coordinate plane plots a piecewise continuous curve. It starts from a solid dot at x equals negative 2 in quadrant 2, declines with a concave downward trend, and intersects the positive y-axis. The curve then rises in quadrant 1, peaks at a value of about 2 on the x-axis. The curve declines and culminates at a solid dot with a value of 3 on the x-axis. The values negative 2, 2, and 3 are marked on the x axis.
